did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Shenandoah County (Va.) Teacher's Register - Daily Record of Pupils' Attendance at Public School No. 20, 1905-1907

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Shenandoah County (Va.) Teacher's Register - Daily Record of Pupils at Public School No. 20, 1905-1907. Local government records collection, Shenandoah County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia under the accession number 40904.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Shenandoah County was formed in 1772 from Frederick County. It was called Dunmore County from 1772 to 1778.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Shenandoah County (Va.) Teacher's Register - Daily Record of Pupils at Public School No. 20, 1905-1907. The register includes names and ages of children, a summary of their attendance (days on the roll, days absent, days present, and days tardy), and a list of subjects they studied. Also included is a list of textbooks used. School No. 20 is also identified as St. Paul School (white), in the Ashby School District.
